intro: Labordia lorenceana, commonly known as the Lorence's labordia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along stream banks or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
